Sept 11th - Wreaths Across America - Wave the Flag

Today Wreaths Across America called for every American to stand outside and wave a flag for one minute at 8:46 a.m., 9:03 a.m., 9:37 a.m.and 10:03 a.m.

At 8:46 a.m. on Sept. 11, 2001, five hijackers took control of American Airlines Flight 11 and flew it into the heart of New York City and the northern facade of the World Trade Center's north tower.

Our 6th Graders stood outside with flags.

At 9:03 a.m., five other hijackers crashed United Airlines Flight 175 into the southern facade of the south tower.

Our 7th Graders stood outside with flags.

At 9:37 a.m., another five hijackers flew American Airlines flight 77 into the western facade of the Pentagon.

Our 8th Graders stood outside with flags.

At 10:03 a.m., four hijackers crashed United Airlines Flight 93 into a field in Stonycreek Township near Shanksville, Pa

All students stood outside with flags at different points outside the school.

East Rutherford took 2nd overall as a school in the Small Schools Sweepstakes category and was ranked in the top ten in the overall tournament.

I have never heard so many compliments on our students in one night! We were asked if we would like to come back and the kids were beyond excited to say ‚ÄúYES!‚Äù. Our Beta Club made us extremely proud as they represented our great school FCDES. Superstars they will always be! As the motto for Beta Club states ‚ÄúLet us Lead by Serving others‚Äù. They truly did.
